New Records: Keider Montero threw his first career complete game shutout.
Key Match Events: Keider Montero delivered a historic complete game shutout, allowing only three hits and no walks on 96 pitches.
Post-Match Reflections: Keider Montero expressed pride and happiness for his performance, stating 'I was over the clouds.'
Manager A.J. Hinch praised Montero's performance, highlighting his potential as an effective major league starter.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The win moved the Tigers closer to the final spot in the American League Wild Card, now just three games behind the Minnesota Twins.
Detroit's bullpen had two full days off in a row, thanks to Montero's complete game shutout and a day off on Monday.
